description: Retrieves the record of an existing introspection. If the retrieval is successful, the result of the instrospection will also be returned. If the retrieval fails the operation, an error message will be returned instead.

parameters.name: introspectionId
parameters.description: The introspection ID. Each introspection contains a unique ID that can be used to reference the instrospection record.

nested_items.name: introspectionId
nested_items.description: The introspection ID. Each introspection contains a unique ID that can be used to reference the instrospection record.

nested_items.name: introspectionStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the introspection during retrieval. By default, when a new instrospection is being retrieved, the status will be set to PROCESSING. Once the operation has been completed, the status will change to SUCCESS or FAILED depending on how the data was parsed. A FAILED operation will return an error and its details as an introspectionStatusDetail.

nested_items.name: introspectionStatusDetail
nested_items.description: The error detail field. When a FAILED introspectionStatus is returned, the introspectionStatusDetail will also return the exact error that was generated during the operation.

nested_items.name: introspectionResult
nested_items.description: The DataSourceIntrospectionResult object data.

nested_items.name: models
nested_items.description: The array of DataSourceIntrospectionModel objects.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the model. For example, this could be the name of a single table in a database.

nested_items.name: fields
nested_items.description: The DataSourceIntrospectionModelField object data.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the field that was retrieved from the introspected data.

nested_items.name: kind
nested_items.description: Specifies the classification of data. For example, this could be set to values like Scalar or NonNull to indicate a fundamental property of the field.
Scalar: Indicates the value is a primitive type (scalar).
NonNull: Indicates the field cannot be null.
List: Indicates the field contains a list.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the data type that represents the field. For example, String is a valid name value.

nested_items.name: values
nested_items.description: The values of the type field. This field represents the AppSync data type equivalent of the introspected field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: length
nested_items.description: The length value of the introspected field.

nested_items.name: primaryKey
nested_items.description: The primary key stored as a DataSourceIntrospectionModelIndex object.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the index.

nested_items.name: fields
nested_items.description: The fields of the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: indexes
nested_items.description: The array of DataSourceIntrospectionModelIndex objects.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the index.

nested_items.name: fields
nested_items.description: The fields of the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: sdl
nested_items.description: Contains the output of the SDL that was generated from the introspected types. This is controlled by the includeModelsSDL parameter of the GetDataSourceIntrospection operation.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: Determines the number of types to be returned in a single response before paginating. This value is typically taken from nextToken value from the previous response.
